segment.source: UnicodeBrailleInput
segment.target: UnicodeBrailleInput

segment.source: Authors: Mesar Hameed, Patrick Zajda, Leonard de Ruijter.
segment.target: Authors: Mesar Hameed, Patrick Zajda, Leonard de Ruijter.

segment.source: Download [stable version][1]
segment.target: Download [stable version][1]

segment.source: This add-on allows you to perform several Braille conversion tasks.
segment.target: This add-on allows you to perform several Braille conversion tasks.

segment.source: For example, you can convert text from braille dot notation (E.G. 1345-1236-145-1) to Unicode or ASCII braille characters.
segment.target: For example, you can convert text from braille dot notation (E.G. 1345-1236-145-1) to Unicode or ASCII braille characters.

segment.source: You can also convert text according to the currently selected input or output braille table, either by typing or pasting it into an input field, or by importing a text file.
segment.target: You can also convert text according to the currently selected input or output braille table, either by typing or pasting it into an input field, or by importing a text file.

segment.source: The result can either be copied to the clipboard or exported into a text or BRF file.
segment.target: The result can either be copied to the clipboard or exported into a text or BRF file.

segment.source: The initial purpose of this specialized addon was to make it easier to help to improve liblouis tables and to add automatic tests for your language.
segment.target: The initial purpose of this specialized addon was to make it easier to help to improve liblouis tables and to add automatic tests for your language.

segment.source: However, with the addition of the unicode braille table in NVDA 2017.3, this add-on is no longer required for that.
segment.target: However, with the addition of the unicode braille table in NVDA 2017.3, this add-on is no longer required for that.

segment.source: Users can now choose to input braille with that table, either via a Braille keyboard or the [PC Keyboard Braille Input add-on][2].
segment.target: Users can now choose to input braille with that table, either via a Braille keyboard or the [PC Keyboard Braille Input add-on][2].

segment.source: Usage example
segment.target: Usage example

segment.source: Open a text editor (for example Notepad plus plus).
segment.target: Open a text editor (for example Notepad plus plus).

segment.source: Press NVDA+Ctrl+i or choose Unicode Braille Input found under NVDA tools menu.
segment.target: Press NVDA+Ctrl+i or choose Unicode Braille Input found under NVDA tools menu.

segment.source: Type your braille text in numeric form or your normal text, respectively. You can also import from a text file if desired.
segment.target: Type your braille text in numeric form or your normal text, respectively. You can also import from a text file if desired.

segment.source: Select whether your input consists of braille dots (e.g. 1345-1236-145-1) or normal text according to a current braille table (e.g. Dutch (Netherlands).
segment.target: Select whether your input consists of braille dots (e.g. 1345-1236-145-1) or normal text according to a current braille table (e.g. Dutch (Netherlands).

segment.source: Select the output type. Leave it to Unicode braille, or change it to BRF or NABC if desired.
segment.target: Select the output type. Leave it to Unicode braille, or change it to BRF or NABC if desired.

segment.source: Select the export type:
segment.target: Select the export type:

segment.source: When set to `Clipboard`, The result will be copied to your clipboard ready for you to paste after pressing OK.
segment.target: When set to `Clipboard`, The result will be copied to your clipboard ready for you to paste after pressing OK.

segment.source: When set to `File`, after pressing OK, a save window will appear.
segment.target: When set to `File`, after pressing OK, a save window will appear.

segment.source: Changes
segment.target: Changes

segment.source: Changes for 5.0
segment.target: Changes for 5.0

segment.source: The add-on now requires NVDA 2024.3 or newer
segment.target: The add-on now requires NVDA 2024.3 or newer

segment.source: Changed radio buttons into combo boxes
segment.target: Changed radio buttons into combo boxes

segment.source: Added output types for ASCII braille (BRF) and NABC (North American Braille Computer Code with full Latin1 character set)
segment.target: Added output types for ASCII braille (BRF) and NABC (North American Braille Computer Code with full Latin1 character set)

segment.source: Changes for 4.1
segment.target: Changes for 4.1

segment.source: The add-on now requires NVDA 2023.1 or newer
segment.target: The add-on now requires NVDA 2023.1 or newer

segment.source: Added support for custom braille tables as input table
segment.target: Added support for custom braille tables as input table

segment.source: Changes for 4.0
segment.target: Changes for 4.0

segment.source: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2024.1
segment.target: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2024.1

segment.source: Changed the gesture to open the Unicode Braille dialog from NVDA+control+u to NVDA+control+i
segment.target: Changed the gesture to open the Unicode Braille dialog from NVDA+control+u to NVDA+control+i

segment.source: Changes for 3.4
segment.target: Changes for 3.4

segment.source: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2023.1
segment.target: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2023.1

segment.source: Changes for 3.3
segment.target: Changes for 3.3

segment.source: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2022.1
segment.target: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2022.1

segment.source: Changes for 3.2
segment.target: Changes for 3.2

segment.source: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2021.1
segment.target: Add-on is compatible with NVDA 2021.1

segment.source: Fixed an issue that caused a traceback when wrong input was provided in dot input mode. A friendly message box is now shown instead
segment.target: Fixed an issue that caused a traceback when wrong input was provided in dot input mode. A friendly message box is now shown instead

segment.source: Updated translations.
segment.target: Updated translations.

segment.source: Changes for 3.1
segment.target: Changes for 3.1

segment.source: The tab order for the radio buttons and the input edit control has been swapped.
segment.target: The tab order for the radio buttons and the input edit control has been swapped.

segment.source: Updated translations.
segment.target: Updated translations.

segment.source: Changes for 3.0
segment.target: Changes for 3.0

segment.source: New maintainer: Leonard de Ruijter.
segment.target: New maintainer: Leonard de Ruijter.

segment.source: Add-on is compatible with Python 3 and therefore with NVDA 2019.3 and above.
segment.target: Add-on is compatible with Python 3 and therefore with NVDA 2019.3 and above.

segment.source: Added the ability to create unicode braille from normal text according to the currently selected input braille table.
segment.target: Added the ability to create unicode braille from normal text according to the currently selected input braille table.

segment.source: Changes for 2.0
segment.target: Changes for 2.0

segment.source: Add-on help is available from the Add-ons Manager.
segment.target: Add-on help is available from the Add-ons Manager.

segment.source: Changes for 1.1
segment.target: Changes for 1.1

segment.source: Improve delay to allow announcements to be heard correctly.
segment.target: Improve delay to allow announcements to be heard correctly.

segment.source: Many new translations.
segment.target: Many new translations.

segment.source: Added documentation under NVDA help menu.
segment.target: Added documentation under NVDA help menu.

segment.source: Added a checkbox to optionally replace the space braille (character 0x2800) by the regular space character.
segment.target: Added a checkbox to optionally replace the space braille (character 0x2800) by the regular space character.

segment.source: Shortcuts can now be reassigned using the NVDA gesture input dialog, under the Tools category.
segment.target: Shortcuts can now be reassigned using the NVDA gesture input dialog, under the Tools category.

segment.source: Changes for 1.0
segment.target: Changes for 1.0

segment.source: Initial release
segment.target: Initial release

segment.source: New Languages: French
segment.target: New Languages: French

segment.source: [1]: http://addons.nvda-project.org/files/get.php?file=ubi
segment.target: [1]: http://addons.nvda-project.org/files/get.php?file=ubi
